meanings.definition: To shrink and thicken (woolen cloth) by moistening, heating, and pressing.
meanings.sent1: She fulled the woolen cloth to make it smaller and thicker.
meanings.sent2: The tailor fulled the fabric to give it a denser texture.
meanings.sent3: After she fulled the cloth, it looked like a cozy blanket.
meanings.sent4: The process of fulling the fabric transformed it into a warm, dense material.
meanings.sent5: The wool was fulled until it became a sturdy, compact fabric.

meanings.definition: To make (cloth) denser and firmer by soaking, beating, and pressing.
meanings.sent1: He fulled the cloth by soaking it in water and pressing it firmly.
meanings.sent2: The traditional method of fulling cloth involved beating and pressing it.
meanings.sent3: The tailor fulled the fabric until it felt like a thick, sturdy material.
meanings.sent4: The fulling process turned the cloth into a dense, firm textile.
meanings.sent5: The fabric was fulled to create a strong, durable material.

meanings.definition: To gather or pleat (fabric) by stitching it down tightly.
meanings.sent1: She fulled the fabric by stitching it tightly to create pleats.
meanings.sent2: The dressmaker fulled the fabric to gather it into elegant pleats.
meanings.sent3: The way she fulled the fabric made the dress look beautifully pleated.
meanings.sent4: The fulling technique resulted in perfectly stitched pleats on the fabric.
meanings.sent5: The fabric was fulled with precision to create neat, tight pleats.

meanings.sent1: The wool began to full as it was exposed to moisture and heat.
meanings.sent2: Over time, the fabric will full naturally to achieve a denser texture.
meanings.sent3: The cloth seemed to full on its own, becoming thicker and more compact.
meanings.sent4: As the material aged, it started to full and develop a firmer feel.
meanings.sent5: The fabric will full gradually, resulting in a tighter weave.
